title: A Good Education Isn't Priceless, Alas
summary: A college degree may be a fine investment. But increasingly, it also comes with hefty debt. According to the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, student loans totaled $956 billion as of 2012's third quarter, up from $529 billion five years earlier.
tag-1: A Good Education Isn't Priceless, Alas
tag-2: A college degree may be a fine investment. But increasingly, it also comes with hefty debt. According to the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, student loans totaled $956 billion as of 2012's third quarter, up from $529 billion five years earlier.
tag-3: Indeed, many graduates are entering the workforce with staggering amounts of debt. The New York Fed reports that the average student loan balance per borrower was $23,300 in 2011, with 10% owing more than $54,000 and 3% owing more than $100,000.
